title: Towards Parallel Learned Sorting
abstract: We introduce a new sorting algorithm that is the combination of ML-enhanced sorting with the In-place Super Scalar Sample Sort (IPS 4 o). The main contribution of our work is to achieve parallel ML-enhanced sorting, as previous algorithms were limited to sequential implementations. We introduce the In-Place Parallel Learned Sort (IPLS) algorithm and compare it extensively against other sorting approaches. IPLS combines the IPS 4 o framework with linear models trained using the Fastest Minimum Conï¬‚ict Degree algorithm to partition data. The experimental results do not crown IPLS as the fastest algorithm. However, they do show that IPLS is competitive among its peers and that using the IPS 4 o framework is a promising approach towards parallel learned sorting.
